body.p: To his Excellency Gov Robinson Governor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner would humbly represent to your Excellency that he has been fined the sum of sixty dollars for the offense of keeping a Tippling House at the February Term of the Circuit Court for Franklin County held in the City of Frankfort, commencing Feb 16th 1863, Judge Draue presiding --

Your Petitioner would represent that he plead guilty to the Indictment since he knew it was a malicious prosecution and he did not desire the case to be unfolded to the public from a sense of delicacy; for he further states that this malicious prosecution was instituted against him by some of his relatives and rather than have one expose the whole matter he plead guilty -- Your Petitioner would further state that he is a poor man with a large family of children to support and that he could not pay this fine without depriving his family of the comforts which he owes them --
Your Petitioner prays the clemency of your Excellency in this case by the remittal of this fine

Lewis L Sullivan
Claimant Feby 17. 1863
Wm Franklin c f b c

Franklin Cir Ct
$60 } Tipling
Remitted except five dollars
J F Robinson
L. L. Sullivan
Issd Feby 18. 1863
